str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To act unjustly towards, injure, harm. From adikos; to be unjust, i.e. do wrong.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To act unjustly towards, injure, harm. From adikos; to be unjust, i.e. do wrong.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Filthy, defiled, dirty. From rhupos; dirty, i.e. cheap or shabby; morally, wicked.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be filthy; hence (morally): To be stained with sin. From rhupos; to soil, i.e. to become dirty.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From dike; equitable; by implication, innocent, holy.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From hagios; to make holy, i.e. purify or consecrate; to venerate.
